instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: Strange keyboard Error
threads.message:
Hi

Working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MB, Came in with faulty keyboard , middle row keys not working only, ie. ASDFGHJKL, assumed faulty keyboard and swapped

New replacement keyboard has except same problem all keys workign except middle row letters

Tested with additional keyboard and exact same fault

Looking at connector and it seems OK

Compared all pins on connector with known working board in Diode mode and all close readings

New to this and not sure what or how to test next

Any help would be great

threads.title: Strange keyboard Error
threads.message: If all pins check out on diode mode it will most likely be a bad connector. The next thing would be <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>.
